page.title: 09Lanjeth Memorial Hall
page.content: The "village" owns the hall.It was built with funds and a grant collected in memory of the soldiers who died during the 1st World War.The caretaker has the key for the hall and lives in Lanjeth.The village hall is used for quite a lot of things such as keep-fit classes, Youth Clubs, Bingo, Whist Drives, Private Hire and coffee mornings.The hall is also used for receptions. They sometimes have band concerts but they are only open to the people who live in Lanjeth.It is also used for luncheon clubs for the elderly people. The hall is very important to the local community. It gives them the opportunity to meet each other and organise events for all the family to enjoy. Sometimes people enjoy getting together for a chat over a cup of coffee. (Lisa Bawden,Katy Milan,Lesley Talbot)
